poem:
**The Dance of Revolution**

In a room above,
the floor whispers of change;
shadows cast off,  
ballet's binds unbound.  
Martha, a vessel of movement,  
steps boldly into history's arms;  
a new rhythm pulses—  
barefoot and defiant,  
as the world pirouettes  
on the edge of new beginnings.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
